abstract.para: The topic covers basic information regarding the supportconfig tool.

topic.para: The tool creates a tar ball in the /var/log directory. Attach the log file tar ball to your service request or if you cannot, email it to the engineer. The gives you more detailed information on working with SUSE Technical Support.

If problems occur, use the supportconfig command-line tool to collect and organize system information and logs to help reduce service request resolution times. Information about the system, such as current kernel version, hardware, installed packages, partition setup, and much more are collected and attached to your service request.
The command-line tool is provided by the package supportutils, which is installed by default. If the package is not installed , install:

The supportconfig can integrate plug-ins that are used with each running of supportconfig command. Which plug-ins are available on your system, depends on the installed packages. The plug-ins are stored in the /usr/lib/supportconfig/plugins/ directory.
The supportconfig tool creates a TAR archive with detailed system information that you can hand over to Global Technical Support.
